Detailed Description

Thread-specific data manager based on pthread thread-specific data functions.

Manager throws an exception of Manager::pthread_exception class if an error occurs

Member Function Documentation

static void cds::threading::pthread::Manager::attachThread (  ) [inline, static]

This method must be called in beginning of thread execution.

If TLS pointer to manager's data is NULL, pthread_exception is thrown with code = -1. If an error occurs in call of pthread API function, pthread_exception is thrown with pthread error code.

static void cds::threading::pthread::Manager::detachThread (  ) [inline, static]

This method must be called in end of thread execution.

If TLS pointer to manager's data is NULL, pthread_exception is thrown with code = -1. If an error occurs in call of pthread API function, pthread_exception is thrown with pthread error code.

static void cds::threading::pthread::Manager::fini (  ) [inline, static]

Terminate manager.

If you explicitly specify the CDS_THREADING_PTHREAD macro at compile time then this function is mandatory and should be called on termination step of your application after using any feature provided by libcds.

static gc::hrc_gc::thread_gc& cds::threading::pthread::Manager::getHRCGC (  ) [inline, static]

Returns gc::hrc::ThreadGC object of current thread.

The object returned may be uninitialized if you did not call Manager::attachThread in the beginning of thread execution or do not use gc::hrc::GarbageCollector. To initialize global gc::hrc::GarbageCollector object you must call cds::gc::hrc::GarbageCollector::Construct() in the beginning of your application

static gc::hzp_gc::thread_gc& cds::threading::pthread::Manager::getHZPGC (  ) [inline, static]

Returns gc::hzp::ThreadGC object of current thread.

The object returned may be uninitialized if you did not call Manager::attachThread in the beginning of thread execution or do not use gc::hzp::GarbageCollector. To initialize global gc::hzp::GarbageCollector object you must call cds::gc::hzp::GarbageCollector::Construct() in the beginning of your application

static gc::ptb_gc::thread_gc& cds::threading::pthread::Manager::getPTBGC (  ) [inline, static]

Returns gc::ptb::ThreadGC object of current thread.

The object returned may be uninitialized if you did not call Manager::attachThread in the beginning of thread execution or do not use gc::ptb::GarbageCollector. To initialize global gc::ptb::GarbageCollector object you must call cds::gc::ptb::GarbageCollector::Construct() in the beginning of your application

static void cds::threading::pthread::Manager::init (  ) [inline, static]

Initialize manager.

If you explicitly specify the CDS_THREADING_PTHREAD macro at compile time then this function is mandatory and should be called before using any feature provided by libcds.
